POSH stands for *Prevention of Sexual Harassment at Workplace*. It ensures safe, respectful, and inclusive workplaces.
The history of POSH in India is rooted in the *Vishaka Guidelines (1997)*, laid down by the Supreme Court after the Bhanwari Devi case. These guidelines became the foundation of the *POSH Act, 2013*.

Sakshi NGO was a key petitioner in the *Vishaka vs State of Rajasthan case (1997)* that led to the Vishaka Guidelines, the first step towards POSH law in India. Sakshi continues to train, guide, and support organizations in implementing POSH.
Under the POSH Act (2013), every employee has the right to a safe workplace free of sexual harassment. Organizations must have an Internal Committee (IC) to handle complaints.
To file a complaint, approach your organization's Internal Committee (IC) or HR. If support is needed, Sakshi NGO can guide and assist in the process.
